page.title: 05A village policeman.
page.content: We interviewed a policeman from Worleston. He starts duty at different times everyday. He wears a navy blue uniform and a pale blue shirt. In the summer if the weather is hot he is allowed to take off his jacket and roll his shirt sleeves up. On his uniform he wears his idenity number 3213. He drives a police van which has radios and accident equipment in it. He is responsible for patrolling 3,000 acres. The main crime is burglary which happens mostly at night. His office is a room in his police house so people can contact him easily.He does not have a police dog but if he needs one he radios for a dog and dog handler. A country policeman has to deal with criminals like poachers and vandals who do not obey the country code. He sometimes has to help the town policemen.
